description: From Middle English isykle, isikel, equivalent to ice +‎ ickle. Cognate with Saterland Frisian Iesjuukel (“icicle”), German Low German Iesjökel, dialectal Danish jisegel (“icicle”), Norwegian isjukel (“icicle”) and Elfdalian aisikkel.

entries.meaning: A drooping, tapering shape of ice.
